```
[trickle] No significant performance differences
```

I missed some of @ncteisen 's comments earlier.

We don't need to always intercept on recv side. The only additional case being added is when a filter adds an error on the receive path. In those case, we also need to intercept for receive trailing metadata.

This helps in that, the filters are themselves responsible for surfacing the error through the only means - recv trailing metadata. The surface could try to do something like save errors from the recv callbacks, but this means that filters could potentially allow recv trailing metadata to go up before recv message. This would require the surface to add some bookkeeping and synchronization behavior between batches. Note that I actually tried to do that before this PR in #16139. (In short, we would need the surface to wait till other batches are done before handling receive trailing metadata.) One additional change required would be to require the surface to consolidate errors from the recv batches.
